A Psalm of David. The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.
The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.

Thy people <FI>shall be<Fi> willing in the day of thy power, in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew of thy youth.<RF>fromâ€¦: or, more than the womb of the morning: thou shalt have, etc<Rf>
The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou <FI>art<Fi> a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.<CM>
The Lord at thy right hand shall strike through kings in the day of his wrath.
He shall judge among the heathen, he shall fill <FI>the places<Fi> with the dead bodies; he shall wound the heads over many countries.<RF>many: or, great<Rf>
He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.<CM>
